message.content: Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.

he error TypeError: Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'CLIP') happens because the location of ProjectItemType varies between Premiere Pro versions (Beta vs Release) and often isn't inside a Constants object in the UXP implementation.

The safest, crash-proof fix is to define these constants explicitly at the top of your file using their stable integer values (which haven't changed in 20 years of Premiere Pro scripting).

Here is the Fixed main.js file.

Fixed: splice-plugin/js/main.js
Changes Made:

Moved require('premierepro') to the top level (better performance).

Defined Constants: Added ProjectItemType mappings explicitly (1=CLIP, 2=BIN) to bypass the API versioning issue entirely.

Updated findFirstMediaItem to use these local constants.
